evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text:
100.  Defendant William Cowen is the Acting General Counsel of the NLRB and is sued in his official capacity.
101.  Defendant National Science Foundation (“NSF”) is a federal agency headquartered in Alexandria, Virginia.  NSF is a federal agency within the meaning of the APA, 5 U.S.C. § 551(1).
102.  Defendant Brian Stone is the Acting Director of the NSF and is sued in his official capacity.
103.  Defendant United States Small Business Administration (“SBA”) is a federal agency headquartered in Washington, D.C.  SBA is a federal agency within the meaning of the APA, 5 U.S.C. § 551(1).
104.  Defendant Kelly Loeffler is the Administrator of the SBA and is sued in his official capacity.
105.  Defendant United States Social Security Administration (“SSA”) is a federal agency headquartered in Baltimore, Maryland.  SSA is a federal agency within the meaning of the APA, 5 U.S.C. § 551(1).
106.  Defendant Leland Dudek is the Acting Commissioner of the SSA and is sued in his official capacity.

extracted.value: Defendants: Marvin Kaplan (Chairman of the NLRB), William Cowen (Acting General Counsel of the NLRB), National Science Foundation (headquartered in Alexandria, Virginia), Brian Stone (Acting Director of the NSF), United States Small Business Administration (headquartered in Washington, D.C.), Kelly Loeffler (Administrator of the SBA), United States Social Security Administration (headquartered in Baltimore, Maryland), Leland Dudek (Acting Commissioner of the SSA).

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: I.  The Constitution’s Distribution of Legislative and Executive Authority With Respect to the Agencies of the Federal Government

extracted.value: Factual Allegation I: The Constitution’s Distribution of Legislative and Executive Authority With Respect to the Agencies of the Federal Government.
